pages.text: Otavia antiqua comes from the Neoproterozoic, with fossils found in the Nama Group, Namibia; Liulaobei Formation, North China and Doushantuo Formation, South China. It is a sponge-like lifeform, growing up to 5 mm in overall size. The generic name derives from the place 'Otavi Group', where the fossils were found. The specific name derives from the Latin word 'antiquus', to mean 'ancient.
